info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 9:33PM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: ...Thunderstorms with Heavy Rain Continue Across the Basin and Range of Western Nevada through 1030 PM PDT... At 930 PM PDT, meteorologists continue to track strong thunderstorms producing heavy rainfall and lightning over the Basin and Range of Western Nevada. These thunderstorms are moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Heavy rainfall, gusty winds to 30 mph, and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Localized flooding of low spots and poor drainage areas. Low visibility within heavy rain. Frequent cloud-to-ground lightning. Locations impacted include... Fallon, Lovelock, Hazen, Oreana, Imlay, Stillwater, Unionville, Trinity Junction, Gerlach-Empire, Seven Troughs Mountain, Rye Patch Reservoir, Silver Hill, Frenchman, Star Peak, Mount Tobin, and Trinity Peak. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Heavy rainfall is occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Remember to slow down and turn on your headlights in heavy rain. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
